channel.title: BoatTour – Vamos a Bailar
channel.description: A traveling blog for discovering South America

item.title: Puerto Lopez: Now I am a diver that saw the whales
item.dc:creator: eric
item.description:
Diving: Open Water Certified My first reason to go to Puerto Lopez was to do a diving certificate. Since I tried the dive last year in Indonesia, I felt in love. From the beginning, it is one of my traveling goals. I found a nice agency hold by a French couple. The course took 3 […]

The post Puerto Lopez: Now I am a diver that saw the whales appeared first on Vamos a Bailar.

item.title: Puno: Uros and Taquile Islands
item.dc:creator: eric
item.description:
Uros Islands Those islands are made of straw and reed. The community counts tens of islands where around 5 families live on each one. Those islands are located only 20 minutes from the city of Puno. The original indigenous doesn’t exist anymore, however, Peruvian people has continued the tradition. The explanations were interesting in order […]

The post Puno: Uros and Taquile Islands appeared first on Vamos a Bailar.

item.title: Ushuaia fin del mundo
item.dc:creator: eric
item.description:
At the beginning, I didn’t plan to get in Patagonia. Too far, renowned expensive, I preferred to avoid it. However, being a nature lover and after lots of recommendations, I change my mind. It would have been such a shame to be so close and miss it. So, I go to the southern part of […]

The post Ushuaia fin del mundo appeared first on Vamos a Bailar.

item.title: A day trip to Tigre
item.dc:creator: eric
item.description:
While spending one month in Buenos Aires, I started to feel oppress by the big city. Thus I was looking for an escape to get nature and peace. I tried two journeys. One to Tigre a classical destination of Porte√±os (the nickname given to inhabitants of Buenos Aires) and a second to another country Uruguay. […]
